Dennis, our host, Impressed me from the get go. In True to Texas character, his hospitality is extraordinary and generous. The beds were terrific, Ultra clean, all amenities easily accessible, many needs anticipated with solutions. It is a large, carefully planned functional space, yet beautiful. His mid- century modern décor had no extra flourishes to detract. The place is spare, open and spectacular, focused on the acres of woodland surrounding it. Plus, the art is FABULOUS.

The host’s guide to local eateries, events, etc. is extensive includes many brochures.

Hope he doesn’t change a thing. Why mess with perfection?

The house is surrounded by woods, parks and has miles of hiking trails. Many square miles of nature call for exploration. The back porch is large and juts out high in the canopy. It really does feel like a treehouse. We would have lived out there but it was august in Texas.

ADVICE: The home is entirely safe for children. But young, undisciplined children are dangerous to the beautiful art and fine collectible furniture. Caution: do not bring children under age 5 and they should be well behaved. Otherwise, you’ll be defending the house 24/7 from destruction. I speak from experience.

We plan to stay in the treehouse again, sans children, so Jody (husband) can work on his book.
